description:
'''''Malipenga''''' is an [[African dance]] music of the [[Tonga people (Malawi)|Tonga people]] of [[Malawi]]. The dance was originated in imitations of [[Military parade|military drills]] when they fought alongside the [[British Army during World War I|British Army]] in [[World War I]].

Malipenga is common in the central and northern regions of Malawi, as in [[Tanzania]], [[Mozambique]], and [[Zambia]] with slight modifications. Each year in August is held a big ''Malipenga'' festival in Northern Malawi in a different town each year.
